result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry A. Schwister

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Original Transcript Housed in 2014CF000172
Sentencing on Revocation - October 21, 2015
(Includes STC as to 2015CF000092 and 2015CF000130)

11:37 am cases called-14CF172, 15CF92 & 15CF130. Defendant Jerry A. Schwister in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement for global resolution stated on record by DA Blader.  15CF92- Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CF92-No Contest to Count 2 & Count 3-without repeater enhancers.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 & Count 4 & 15CF130. All matters now postured for sentencing. 14CF172-Revocation Order and Warrant received-no corrections or clarifications by either counsel. PSI discussed and defendant waives a PSI being conducted. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Wallace. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 14CF172- 6 years Wisconsin State Prison System to be served as 3 years Initial Confinement & 3 years Extended Supervision. 136 days credit. Costs re-imposed as not previously paid-25% of inmate earnings. 15CF92- COUNT 2- 6 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served at 3 years Initial Confinement & 3 years Extended Supervision, concurrent to 14CF172. Credit for 136 days.  15CF92- Count 3-SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years, consecutive to 14CF172 & 15CF92-Count 2. CONDITIONS OF ES & Probation: Not to obtain ANY prescription from ANY physician without the express authorization of the supervising agent and after the agent has discussed the situation the defendant faces with the treating physician. Defendant is to sign all necessary releases. Defendant is NEVER to obtain a prescription from more than one physician unless and until express authorization from the agent. AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs ordered plus $320 buy reimbursement assessed. 25 % of inmate earnings. Court finds defendant eligible for CIP & SAP. DNA sample to be provided & surcharge. Appeal Rights Given.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:20 PM: Defendant Jerry A. Schwister in court, in person, with attorney John H. Wallace, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def agrees to allow counsel to participate in this hearing today via telephone today.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves Def with Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Atty Wallace confirms PO Hold currently in place.  DA argues as to $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection to bond request.  Court discusses nature of Pre-Lim and Time Limits. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 Day time limits for preliminary hearing.   Court orders $5000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  STC Scheduled with other pending matters - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
